title: (x) Solcrest group logos - Apex New {Angel}
content:
Thanks for your help identifying these fonts.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080111001328im_/http:/typophile.com/files/solcrest_id_03_3816.gif)

 [‹ (x) Rocco Italian Restaurant website header - Nevison, ITC Edwardian Script {Marcelo Rodi}](http://web.archive.org/web/20080111001328/http:/typophile.com/node/35776 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Calligraphic semiserif - ITC Humana Serif {Marcelo Rodi} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080111001328/http:/typophile.com/node/35769 "Go to next forum topic")
author: megtcopp

comments.content:
Apex New Medium & Medium Caps. The l could be an I.

[http://www.vllg.com/Thirstype/ApexNew/mudTyper+Weights/](http://web.archive.org/web/20080111001328/http:/www.vllg.com/Thirstype/ApexNew/mudTyper+Weights/ "http://www.vllg.com/Thirstype/ApexNew/mudTyper+Weights/")

Megtcopp:

Angel is correct, it is Apex New. We modified the UC “L” glyph and removed the “tail” for this mark. The descriptor line is Medium set in LC small caps (tracked 25%, too).

Feel free to email us ( [inquiry@brandsbyovo.com](mailto:inquiry@brandsbyovo.com)) with these questions. We aren’t too terribly unfriendly. ;)

Kyle Hildebrant
